text.author: DaGizza, Wrh2Bot, Ikan Kekek and others (see URL)
text.title: Vava'u
text.summary1: (human1) Vava’u is a group of over 50 tropical islands in Tonga, featuring the town of Neiafu on the main island Utu Vava’u, with a harbour which attracts over 500 yachts every winter between June and October, Pangaimotu, an island with secluded beaches and good snorkeling, and Hunga Island with humpback whales to see from June to November.
text.summary2: (human2) Vava'u, group of over 50 islands in Tonga, has a tropical climate, is home to diverse wildlife like humpback whales, has many popular beaches in the main islands of Utu Vavau, Pangaimotou, and Hunga Island, and attracts many tourists to Neiafu, the main center of activity in the islands.
text.summary3: (human3) Vava'u is a tropical beach destination in Tonga that appeals to wealthy and budget travelers alike consisting of more than 50 islands with the main town, Neiafu, located on the biggest island, Utu Vava'u.
text.summary4: (human4) Vava'u is a group of more than 50 islands in Tonga, which was inhabited by early Polynesians approximately 3000 years ago, has an official port of entry for over 500 yachts every sailing season called Neiafu, has a tropical climate with average temperatures from 24 to 29º C, and has three main islands: Utu Vava’u, Pangaimotu, and Hunga Island.
text.summary5: (human5) Vava'u is a beautiful tropical island group in Tonga, and a popular tourist destination from June to October; its main attractions include the harbour city of Neiafu, along with numerous beaches, coral atolls, boat tours to see humpback whales, and Mt. Talau national park.
